title: Sitiveni Moceidreke
text:
Sitiveni Moceidreke (born 27 November 1994) is a <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fiji</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and for <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">RFL Championship</a> competition. He has previously played for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, Australia, Moceidreke is of <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>an descent. He played his junior rugby league for <a href="Hurstville%20United">Hurstville United</a>, before being signed by the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2012, Moceidreke played for <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George Dragons</a> in the <a href="SG%20Ball">SG Ball</a> competition. In 2013 and 2014, Moceidreke moved up to <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra">St George Illawarra</a>'s <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team. He then signed with the <a href="Illawarra%20Cutters">Illawarra Cutters</a> for the 2015 season. In 2016, he signed with the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a>. In the same year, Moceidreke played for Fiji against Papua New Guinea in the <a href="Pacific%20Rugby%20League%20International%23Melanesian%20Cup%202">2016 Melanesian Cup</a>, playing at five-eighth. Later in the year, he again played for Fiji against <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a>, playing at fullback. Moceidreke continued to be a mainstay of The North Sydney team in 2016 making a total of 21 appearances for the season.
2017.
Moceidreke began the 2017 playing for the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a> in the <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a>. After an impressive performance in the ISP round 2 match, scoring four tries, he was signed by the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>. On his NRL debut in the fourth round, he scored the only try for South Sydney in their 20–6 loss to the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>. Moceidreke was selected in the Fijian squad to play in the 2017 <a href="Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">Rugby League World Cup</a>. On 15 November 2017, it was revealed that Moceidreke had signed a deal with <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> feeder club side The <a href="Mount%20Pritchard%20Mounties">Mount Pritchard Mounties</a> for The 2018 season as part of an opportunity to get a trial and train contract for the <a href="NRL">NRL</a> squad.
2018.
Moceidreke made 19 appearances for Mounties scoring 9 tries and kicking 52 goals finishing with a total of 140 points for the season.
2019.
After being released by Canberra, Moceidreke joined the Sunshine Coast in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> competition.
2020.
Moceidreke played for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> at the <a href="2020%20NRL%20Nines">NRL Nines</a> in <a href="Perth%2C%20Western%20Australia">Perth, Western Australia</a>.
2021.
In January 2021, he joined <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra">St. George</a> in the <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a>. He made his debut in round 1 of the competition against Newtown at <a href="Kogarah%20Oval">Kogarah Oval</a>.
2022.
In January 2022, it was announced that he had signed for London Broncos in the Championship.
